intro: Scorzonera meshhedensis, commonly known as the Meshhed scurvygrass, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, thriving in well-drained soils. Its leaves are basal, often hairy, and its flowers are yellow with a central disc. Scorzonera meshhedensis is noted for its medicinal properties and has been used in traditional remedies for various ailments.
